intro: Deinandra paniculata, commonly known as the yellow wood or yellow antelope bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are arranged in panicles, which are branched inflorescences, giving it its species name "paniculata." The plant is well adapted to arid conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
